docs.title: Welcome to wafrunner-cli
docs.text:
This is the main documentation site for the wafrunner-cli project.

This documentation contains non-code assets that are useful for project development, such as design files and reference materials. The contents are shared across the team but are not part of the application's build or distribution.

To add more pages, create new .md files in this docs/ directory and add them to the nav section of the mkdocs.yml file.

docs.title: wafrunner update
docs.text: The update command downloads the latest CVE ID to vulnID lookup data and stores it in a local database.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: wafrunner update

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text: This guide covers the basic commands to get started with wafrunner-cli.

docs.title: Configuring the CLI
docs.text:
Before you can use the tool, you need to set your API key. You can do this interactively:

wafrunner configure set-api-key

docs.title: Searching for Data
docs.text:
To perform a basic search, use the data search command:

wafrunner data search "log4j" --limit 5

docs.title: Collection Commands
docs.text: The collection command group provides tools for managing local collections of vulnerabilities.

docs.title: Creating a New Collection
docs.text: You can create a new collection of vulnerabilities using the create subcommand. This is useful for grouping related vulnerabilities for analysis or reporting.

docs.title: From a List of Identifiers
docs.text:
You can create a collection by providing a list of CVE IDs or vulnerability IDs directly on the command line:

wafrunner collection create my-first-collection --id CVE-2021-44228 --id a1ddadd4-1b9d-4fab-90fe-64c1c763cd58

docs.title: From a File
docs.text:
If you have a text file containing a list of identifiers (one per line), you can use the --file option:

# my_ids.txt
CVE-2021-44228
a1ddadd4-1b9d-4fab-90fe-64c1c763cd58

wafrunner collection create my-second-collection --file my_ids.txt

docs.title: Listing Collections
docs.text:
To see all of your local collections, use the list subcommand:

wafrunner collection list

docs.title: Showing a Collection
docs.text:
To view the contents of a specific collection, use the show subcommand:

wafrunner collection show my-first-collection

docs.title: Deleting a Collection
docs.text:
To remove a collection, use the delete subcommand:

wafrunner collection delete my-first-collection

docs.title: Configuring the CLI
docs.text: The configure command group allows you to manage the settings for wafrunner-cli.

docs.title: Setting Your API Key
docs.text: The most important configuration is setting your API key, which is required to authenticate with the wafrunner platform.

docs.title: Interactive Prompt
docs.text:
The easiest way to set your key is to run the command without any arguments. You will be prompted to enter your key securely:

wafrunner configure set-api-key

The CLI will hide your input for security.

docs.title: Non-Interactive (via Option)
docs.text:
You can also provide the key directly as an option. This is useful for scripting and automated environments.

wafrunner configure set-api-key --api-key YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY

docs.title: CVE Commands
docs.text: The cve command group allows you to retrieve detailed information about specific Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs).

docs.title: Get CVE Details
docs.text: You can fetch comprehensive details for a given CVE ID using the get subcommand.

docs.title: By CVE ID
docs.text:
Provide the full CVE ID as an argument to retrieve its information:

wafrunner cve get CVE-2021-44228

This command will return a detailed JSON response containing all available information for the specified CVE.

docs.title: Example Output
docs.text:
{
  "cveId": "CVE-2021-44228",
  "description": "Apache Log4j2 JNDI features...",
  "severity": "CRITICAL",
  "publishedDate": "2021-12-10T00:00:00Z",
  "references": [
    "https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44228"
  ]
}

docs.title: Lookup CVE and Vulnerability IDs
docs.text: You can use the lookup command to find the corresponding CVE ID for a vulnerability ID, or vice-versa.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
wafrunner cve lookup <IDENTIFIER>

Replace <IDENTIFIER> with either a CVE ID or a vulnerability ID.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
$ wafrunner cve lookup CVE-2024-21710
{
  "cve_id": "CVE-2024-21710",
  "vuln_id": "a1ddadd4-1b9d-4fab-90fe-64c1c763cd58"
}

$ wafrunner cve lookup a1ddadd4-1b9d-4fab-90fe-64c1c763cd58
{
  "cve_id": "CVE-2024-21710",
  "vuln_id": "a1ddadd4-1b9d-4fab-90fe-64c1c763cd58"
}

docs.title: Interacting with Data
docs.text: The data command group provides tools for searching and retrieving data from the wafrunner platform.

docs.title: Searching for Data
docs.text: You can perform a free-text search across various data sources using the search command.

docs.title: Basic Search
docs.text:
To run a search, provide a query string as an argument. By default, the search will return up to 10 results.

wafrunner data search "log4j exploit"

docs.title: Limiting Results
docs.text:
You can control the number of results returned by using the --limit or -l option:

wafrunner data search "ProxyLogon" --limit 25

docs.title: Research Commands
docs.text: The research command group helps you initiate research tasks against vulnerability identifiers.

docs.title: GitHub Repository Search
docs.text: You can trigger a search for public GitHub repositories related to a specific vulnerability.

docs.title: By Single Identifier
docs.text:
To search for a single vulnerability, provide either a CVE ID or a vulnerability ID using the --id option:

wafrunner research github --id CVE-2021-44228

wafrunner research github --id a1ddadd4-1b9d-4fab-90fe-64c1c763cd58

docs.title: From a Collection
docs.text:
If you have a collection of vulnerability identifiers, you can process them in bulk:

wafrunner research github --collection my-collection

The tool requires that you provide either --id or --collection, but not both.

docs.title: Scrape Data Sources
docs.text:
You can also trigger a scrape of all data sources associated with a vulnerability:

wafrunner research scrape --id CVE-2021-44228

This command will fetch all related links and initiate a data scrape for each one.
